title: A Cascaded Architecture for Extractive Summarization of Multimedia Content via Audio-to-Text Alignment
author: Tanzir Hossain (Dept. of CSE Brac University), Ar-Rafi Islam (Dept. of CSE BRAC University), Md. Sabbir Hossain (Dept. of CSE BRAC University), Annajiat Alim Rasel (Dept. of CSE BRAC University), ...
relevance_why: The paper addresses the summarization of multimedia content, which is relevant to audio and speech applications, especially in creating concise summaries from diverse audio-visual sources. This could enhance research in audio data processing.
background: Extractive summarization involves identifying and extracting the most important information from multimedia content, such as YouTube videos, to create a concise summary.
contribution: This paper introduces a cascaded architecture that combines audio-to-text alignment with extractive summarization techniques, achieving improved summarization performance over traditional methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods frequently struggled with transcoding audio to text and summarizing large volumes of multimedia content efficiently.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work leverages an advanced cascade process integrating Microsoft Azure Speech, Whisper, and transformers like PEGASUS and BART for improved extractive summarization.

key_innovation: This methodology integrates complex audio-to-text processing with state-of-the-art summarization models, allowing for effective extraction of meaningful insights from multimedia.
real_world_impact: The proposed framework aims to significantly enhance information retrieval and accessibility in multimedia contexts, particularly beneficial for users of platforms like YouTube.
limitations: Authors identified transcription errors and coherence issues as challenges for their approach.

new_terms.extractive summarization: **Extractive summarization** involves selecting and concatenating key sentences or segments from a source text to create a summary.
new_terms.audiovisual: **Audiovisual** pertains to content that includes both sound (audio) and visual (video) components, commonly used in multimedia formats like videos.
